description: From Italian dilettante, prop. present participle of dilettare (“to delight”), from Latin dēlectāre (“to delight”).

adjectives.description: dilettante (comparative more dilettante, superlative most dilettante)

entries.meaning: Pertaining to or like a dilettante.
An amateur, someone who dabbles in a field out of casual interest rather than as a profession or serious interest.
(sometimes offensive) A person with a general but superficial interest in any art or a branch of knowledge.
